Office Hours
:
Monday - Thursday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm
Friday - 8am - 12 pm excluding holidays
Location: 105 Municipal Avenue
Mailing Address: P.O. Box 1219, Sopchoppy, 32358
Phone: (850) 962-4611
Fax: (850) 962-3429
For Campground Inquiries call:
(850) 962-5468 or (850) 756-0823.
Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public-records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact the appropriate office by phone or in writing.

Clerk/Administration
This office is dedicated to serving the community in a professional, ethical, impartial and equitable manner.
Ashley Schilling, City Clerk
(850) 962-4611
(office)
(850) 661-0237
(cell)
P.O. Box 1219, Sopchoppy, FL 32358
[email protected]
Accomplishments and Service:
Ashley Schilling began her employment with the City of Sopchoppy in 2004 and was appointed in June 2016 to serve as the Clerk of Sopchoppy. Mrs. Schilling has her A.S. in Business Administration/Accounting from St. Petersburg College and has completed the requirements to earn the designation of Certified Municipal Clerk through the International Institute of Municipal Clerks. She is a member of the International Institute of Municipal Clerks and the Florida Association of City Clerks.
The City Clerk is appointed by and serves under the direction of the City Council.  The Clerk's office is the oldest profession in municipal government providing an array of services to the public.  This office is dedicated to serving the community in a professional, ethical, impartial and equitable manner.  A Municipal Clerk performs activities prescribed by state and local laws.
Duties and responsibilities of the clerk include:
City Administrator
Qualifying officer for candidates who wish to contend for the office of City Council.
Records Management and Custodian of all official records in compliance with state law; serves as the City's Records Management Liaison Officer with the State of Florida Department of State.
Custodian of the city seal
Provides notice of Council Meetings, Attends meetings and prepares minutes of proceedings
Prepares and administers the annual budget for the city. Maintains financial records.
Human Resource management
Grant Administration
Administers land development regulations, zoning and comprehensive plan
Negotiates Agreements and Contracts on behalf of the City
Represents the City on various committees
Page Bonds, Deputy Clerk
(850) 962-4611(office)
P.O. Box 1219, Sopchoppy, FL 32358
[email protected]
As Deputy Clerk,
Page works closely with the City Clerk and the Public Works Director in all
areas.
Duties and
responsibilities of the Deputy Clerk include:
Supervisor of Utility
billing department and staff
Accounts payable
Preparation of County
and State Tax reports and payment
Reconciliation of
utility software and account software integration
Preparation of sewer
reports and payments
Preparation of
monthly state water reports and consumptive use reports
IT liaison
Preparing reports for
the City Council
